column99: Student assistant/internship at the STRING Secretariat
column100:
Are you a skilled and structured student assistant, who wants to be a driving force behind the application of alternative fuels and sustainable transport in Scandinavia and Germany? Then you might be our new student assistant or fulltime intern in the STRING Secretariat! 
 Application deadline:  May 20 th  2022 
 Working place:  Copenhagen 
 STRING is a political cross-border organisation consisting of five cities and eight regions from Hamburg to Oslo. Together we are working to become the STRING megaregion, globally acknowledged as a Green Hub for clean technologies and a leading implementer of sustainable infrastructure solutions. 
 We are searching for a self-driven and outgoing student assistant or fulltime intern, who can support different initiatives concerning project management and lobbying activities by assisting the Secretariat team in a rage of coordinative and administrative tasks. You can find more information about the projects on our website:  www.stringnetwork.org . We are looking for an student assistant 3-4 days a week and/or a fulltime intern. You will work in a Secretariat with eight colleagues in central Copenhagen. 
 Your tasks can cover, but are not limited to: 
 
 
 Assistance to the project manager, mainly on; 
 
 
 a project relating to building a hydrogen corridor between Oslo and Hamburg 
 
 
 lobbying initiatives for fixed links across the Öresund and improved railway between Oslo and Gothenburg 
 
 
 STRINGs efforts of positioning ourselves as an internationally acknowledged Green Hub 
 
 
 
 
 Keeping track of solved and outstanding project tasks 
 
 
 Assistance in the arrangement of meetings 
 
 
 Assistance in stakeholder analysis 
 
 
 Administrative coordination 
 
 
 Preparation of meeting material 
 
 
 Meeting logistics 
 
 
 Preparation of power-point presentations 
 
 
 Background research and ad-hoc tasks 
 Requirements: 
 
 
 You have a bachelor degree and are enrolled in a relevant Master degree like e.g.  political science , public administration etc. 
 
 
 You are fluent in English + one of the Scandinavian languages or German 
 
 
 You enjoy working in a dynamic political environment 
 
 
 You are self-driven and have a problem-solving attitude 
 
 
 You are detailed-oriented and passionate about bringing structure into things 
 
 
 It is an asset, if you have relevant working experience in the field 
 
 
 You are comfortable interacting with a range of different stakeholders from different disciplines. 
 
 
 You are quick, efficient and agile to solve many different tasks at once under sometimes short time constraints. 
 We are offering: 
 
 
 A student job with ca. 20 working hours a week or a fulltime internship starting in May 2022 or as soon as possible 
 
 
 A flexible working environment where you will be given the responsibility to run your own projects 
 
 
 The flexibility to choose your own hours as long as the job gets done 
 
 
 Dedicated and interactive colleagues 
 
 
 The opportunity to adjust your tasks based on your competencies and working experience 
   
 Is the job something for you? 
 Please send your cover letter, CV and transcript of records to thbec@stringnetwork.org with the reference “application as student assistant or intern in STRING”. If you have further questions about the position, please contact Thomas Becker, Managing Director, STRING Secretariat via mail thbec@stringnetwork.org or phone +45 29 61 70 10. 
   
   
 
 Om Region Sjælland 
Vi er regionens største arbejdsplads med mere end 19.000 medarbejdere og et budget på 19 mia. kroner. Vi løser opgaver inden for sundhed, psykiatri og regional udvikling og driver en række sociale institutioner. Klik ind på  www.regionsjaelland.dk  og læs mere om regionens opgaver, struktur og geografi. Du finder os også på  Facebook ,  Twitter  og  LinkedIn .
